author: Staff Reporter
text:
Two child marriages were stopped by the timely intervention of officials here on Tuesday.

In the first incident, a Plus One student in Komarapalayam was to be married off to a 32-year-old man of Kangeyam in Tirupur. A team comprising officials from District Anti Human Trafficking Wing, Childline, and District Child Protection Unit along with revenue officials visited the girl’s home and stopped the marriage.

In another incident, a Plus One student of Rasipuram was to be married off a 27-year-old man of the same area. The team visited the girl’s home and warned them not to continue with the marriage. Written statement was obtained from both the parents that they would not perform marriage for their daughters until the girls complete 18 years of age. The girls would be produced before the Child Welfare Committee (CWC) on Friday.
title: Two child marriages stopped
